verdict.summary: A stream was destroyed or closed before it finished being consumed. Common with HTTP responses, file streams, and pipeline operations.

dead_ends.action: Ignoring the error by adding an empty error handler
dead_ends.why_fails: The stream data is lost; downstream consumers receive incomplete data which causes silent data corruption

dead_ends.action: Manually calling stream.destroy() then continuing to read
dead_ends.why_fails: Once destroyed, a stream cannot be read from; any further read attempts throw or return null

workarounds.action: Use stream.pipeline() instead of manual pipe chains for proper error propagation
workarounds.how: const { pipeline } = require('stream/promises'); await pipeline(readable, transform, writable);

workarounds.action: Handle the 'error' and 'close' events on all streams in the pipeline
workarounds.how: readable.on('error', handleErr); writable.on('error', handleErr); writable.on('close', cleanup);

leads_to.condition: when code tries to use the stream after premature close

preceded_by.condition: when a network connection reset causes the readable stream to close early

frequently_confused_with.distinction: ERR_STREAM_PREMATURE_CLOSE fires when a stream closes before being fully consumed, while ERR_USE_AFTER_CLOSE fires when you try to use an already-closed resource
